page.title: 01Long Cross
page.content: The South Tyne/Allendle watershed runs Nw SE across this block. The land falls south west towards SouthTynedale with Ayle Burn making a steep valley in which are situaed 2 small drift mines, Ayle Colliery and Clarghyll Colliery,employing about 50 minersExtensive conifer plantations in south of block and intensively farmed hay and grazing fields around Ayle Burn in sw cnr of block. Clarghyll Hall a rebuilt pele tower, and 3 arms are in same area. Est of Long Cross the fells are heather covered,used for rough grazing and grouse shooting. Ayle common in nw corner used for rough grazing, mixed heather, fell grassland and high wetland. Main Alston/Hexham rd crosses block from NE to SW.
